Yes! Hungary has a rich cultural heritage, and there are many ways to immerse yourself in Hungarian culture beyond attending festivals. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Visit Budapest's Great Market Hall - this market hall is full of local produce, handicrafts, and other Hungarian souvenirs. You'll get a chance to see traditional Hungarian food being made and sold, and maybe even try some local treats. 2. Bathe in a hot spring - Budapest is known for its thermal baths and hot springs, which are a traditional part of Hungarian culture. Visiting one of the city's many spas is a great way to relax, unwind, and experience traditional Hungarian relaxation techniques. 3. Visit a traditional Hungarian village - there are many small traditional villages throughout Hungary, such as Hollókő, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Exploring these villages and learning about their unique culture and traditions can be a great way to immerse yourself in Hungarian history and culture. 4. Attend a Hungarian cooking class - Hungarian cuisine is famous for its hearty stews, soups, and pastries. Taking a cooking class from a local chef can be a fun way to learn about traditional Hungarian recipes and cooking techniques. 5. Visit a traditional Hungarian folk art museum - there are many museums throughout Hungary dedicated to preserving and promoting the country's traditional folk art. Visiting one of these museums can be a great way to learn about Hungarian culture and see some beautiful examples of traditional Hungarian handicrafts. These are just a few examples of the many ways to immerse yourself in Hungarian culture. Hungary is a country with a rich cultural heritage, and there's always something new to discover!
